intro_text:
Hello little explorers! Today, we're going to have fun with a new sound. Can anyone guess which one? It's the sound 'd' – super cool, isn't it? 

Now let's pretend to be a little doggie. Yes, you heard me right! Do you know the noise a doggie makes when he finds his favorite toy? He says 'd-d-dig', 'd-d-dig' in his doggie language. Try saying it with me – 'd-d-d'. Good job! 

You see, when you make the 'd' sound, your tongue touches the top of your mouth, right behind your top front teeth. Say 'd-d-d-d'. Awesome! 

So remember, every time you see this letter 'D', imagine a doggie digging for his toy, and it will help you say the sound 'd'!

Keep practicing, buddies! I’m so proud of all of you.
follow_up_question: Alright, team, pop quiz time! Are you ready? Now, think of the noise our pretend doggie makes while it's digging. Here's your question: Can you tell me a word that starts with the same 'd-d-d' sound? Is it 'cat' or is it 'duck'? Remember, 'd-d-d'. Now, can anyone shout out the answer?
story: Dad has a dog. The dog dug. Dad did not mind.
